Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for family fun.”
Reviews.Author: Nelliesmom
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel to stay in,it's in walking distance of many things. Clean room and very reasonably priced. My mom and I went for a show at the Andy Williams Theater which is right next door and spent the rest ofthe weekend shopping. Perfect for thsi. We did not swim, eat breakfast, or use any of the ammenities. They seemed nice though. The staff was very nice. They also have a frequent stayers reward card. This is perfect for an inexpensive weekenf away.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Duke”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Awesome location and great service! I was vigiting my son who just started his PhD pgm and found this gem. Rates are on the higher end but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stunk!”
Reviews.Author: amandaroach8
Reviews.Content: We arrived right at check-in time, 3pm. There wasn't any problem getting into the room. The air was on when we arrived and smelled a little musty. We had a very busy schedule to attend to so we headed out. We got back late and turn the a/c fan on to drown out all the noise of the neighbors. It smelled so bad I couldn't sleep and was worried about my 2 kids breathing in this nasty smell. I looked in the vents of the a/c and there was mold everywhere. We turned it off and set the a/c on high. It was hot, but didn't smell as bad. We left early to stay on schedule. I wanted to switch rooms but thought they all might be like that since there was mold growing on the sidewalk outside all the rooms. We also didn't want to pack up all of our stuff from two infants. We will never stay there again, gross.

Reviews.Title: “Great manager”
Reviews.Author: d e
Reviews.Content: A great staff makes up for the older motel. It is clean and quiet. The location like all Hw 76 motels is close to most shows. The manager works hard to keep up with everyone he meets. I would recommend the Gazebo as long as you understand this is an older motel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Bsully0806
Reviews.Content: Room was clean with plenty of towels, mini fridge , more than I expected for the price. Pool was 24 hours which was nice. Beautiful breakfast room with an attendant that served a nice selection for a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JillybeaninMO
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling a lot this year and staying in hotels. This hotel was free with a RCI timeshare tour (don't waste your time the tour took much longer then what my husband and I were promised over the phone, and you must fight thru the ticket/prize office, a separate business, to get the prizes you were promised over the phone when you bought the package). This was the worse hotel room we have stayed in this summer. The tv was older, smaller and fuzzy. My husband kept having to mess with the air all night to keep it working. The room was smaller and tighter than a lot of hotel rooms. And, there were warnings in the shower and above the sink about the hot water being really hot, and it was! You couldn't even turn it a little over from cold without it burning you. It would also get hotter at times during a shower. And, you would come in to wash your hands or shower, and the maid had left it over on hot! I am very glad that I didn't have younger kids with me! The free continental breakfast was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights first of August. First trip to Branson. Went with wife, sister,& brother in-law. Easy check-in, nice room. In walking distance of many activities. Would recommend. Especially close to Shipley's Donuts and DUKS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice centrally located hotel at the right price. Kid friendly!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMike B
Reviews.Content: A real value centrally located in Branson on 76 Boulavard. Not a lot of frills, just a nice clean room. Free breakfast and an outdoor pool by the strip. Booked it for around $45 total on Hotwire in July.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Enjoy Your Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Make_It_Count4U
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Branson for our 19th wedding anniversary and this place was great because location was convenient to everything, staff was very friendly, facility was very clean and we will be coming back. I would recommend upgrading to get the whirlpool tub - that's so relaxing when you've had a busy, hot day. Plus, our room had a very comfortable bed and I was amazed by how quiet this location was. The only thing that could have made this place better would be a couple of chairs outside your room to enjoy. You could sit at the pool and up front, but for the rooms in the back, it was a long walk to the front and beautiful pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Gazebo Inn”
Reviews.Author: RJ2Missouri
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire for $34 and were pleasantly surprised. Double queen beds were comfy with extra pillows in the cabinet. Large vanity in the bathroom. Plenty of towels and washcloths for our family. Air conditioner was running upon arrival. Great on an extra hot day. Pool was open 24 hours and had sparkling clean water. Breakfast included MYO waffles, donuts, cereals, juice, bagels, etc. Breakfast room was small but the attendant was very nice. Great location. Located across the hwy from the outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melaney R
Reviews.Content: We rarely stay in a private hotel and were OK with this one but probably won't stay there again. It is clean and quiet but needs updating both in the furniture, bathroom facilities. We have learned in Branson that, for the same amount of money, we are able to rent one of the many, many condos available on either a daily or a weekly rate. The location of the Gazebo Inn is wonderful, the continental breakfast is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BamaGirl1313
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked this hotel with a travel package. The location is great for getting to most of the shows on the main road in Branson. Quite a few things were within walking distance so we didn't have to mess with the traffic. Our room was a typical double queen (like you see in every hotel) with one exception...this was the cleanest hotel room I have ever seen, including the bathroom! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to book a dinner cruise through the front desk. The lady running the breakfast was extremely friendly, I forgot to get her name! The hotel was in the middle of replacing the railings around the porch and pool area and the back stairs due to the tornado damage. When it is finished, this will be a beautiful hotel. I didn't give a five rating because the rooms really need updating and the breakfast room is too small for the number of customers staying at the hotel (could only fit 12 comfortably). We sat on the wraparound porch and had our coffee, which was very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: GweninTX
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, nothing fancy. Beds a little hard for me. Huge jacuzzi tub in our king size bed room. I was most impressed with the free breakfast - hot waffles you cook fresh, bagels, donuts, English muffins, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, peaches, 3 cold cereals and instant oatmeal. Much better than most free breakfasts. Pleasant front desk. If you cannot do stairs or step hills ask for a room that is in the main building. We did not mind the walk, but it could be issue for others. Great location by And Williams theatre and easy to get to the Yellow route to avoid traffic jams.

Reviews.Title: “people very nice”
Reviews.Author: coolecg
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in the past also, room clean. staff very friendly and helpful. Still under minor repair from tornado. Limited flat parking, mostly parking on a hill.

Reviews.Title: “The Gazebo Inn-Branson”
Reviews.Author: mdhicks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gazebo Inn celebrating our 25th Anniversary. We stayed in the honeymoon suite thinking it would be the best of all rooms. Each morning at 6:30 am you could hear things banging around and people talking. It was the staff getting the continental breakfast set up. When I told them my disappointment of being woke up so early each morning, we were told that is what you get when your room is right above the eating area. We were not made aware that the room was above the eating area, but it was not the guests who made noise it was the staff. Very disappointed in my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationsForMe2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel probably a dozen times or so in the past few years when we come to Branson. We keep coming back because we are always pleased with the comfortable and clean rooms, nice quick breakfast, friendly staff, awesome price all year round, and location. Everything is always above standard and we appreciate that so much. They even call you shortly after you get into your room to make sure it's satisfactory, which is a special touch. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Charged $25 to ship my cell-phone charger I left behind”
Reviews.Author: Michelle K
Reviews.Content: The room was fine. It was clean and pretty typical for a hotel room. We got to breakfast about 45 minutes before ending time and all of the donuts were gone (none left to replenish stock they said). When I got home I realized I had left my cell phone charger still plugged in on the bathroom counter. The lady said it would be no problem to ship it to me (I live 4 hours away, same state), took my credit card number, and didn't give me a quote on the price. I assumed it would be around $10 maximum and was very surprised to see my credit card was billed for $25. The inn charged $10 for their trouble, and $15 were shipping fees, box, packaging, confirmation, etc. I thought that was outrageous. But live and learn, right?

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed rate raised at check-in”
Reviews.Author: jmbrug
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 rooms on Gazebo Inn's web site but when we arrived to check-in they said they couldn't honor the rate quoted on the web site-they claimed it was only good until June. Our confirmation clearly gave the confirmed rate and the check-in date of November, so that didn't get our stay off to a very good start. The rooms were pretty basic with 2 queen beds but they did have a small refrigerator. Both rooms could use some updating. The carpet had big stains by the door and needed a good cleaning. The shower had black mold on the wall above it and the tub also needed a good cleaning. The breakfast offered waffles, cold cereals, yogurt, juice and coffee. With all the motels available in Branson, I will definately look elsewhere for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Branson”
Reviews.Author: daisydollar
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Branson, MO last week and stayed at a beautiful hotel called The Gazebo. We had purchased on line, however, we upgraded to a king room once we arrived. They had wonderful beds. Very clean room. Hospitality was outstanding. Also they had a wonderful little tea room for your complimentary continental breakfast. Everyone was very hospitable. We will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Gazebo Inn - Great stay”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGal22
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson, MO and stayed at the Gazebo Inn two nights. Front desk was friendly. Room was clean. Breakfast served was hot and good amount of selection.

Reviews.Title: “Actually left for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen b
Reviews.Content: We aren't picky being a military family and used to being all over the globe but this was awful. I have never requested to leave a hotel before until this one. Pictures are misleading, room and bathroom was filthy, a/c didn't want to work, old/frayed furniture/bedspread and whirlpool tub stained and cracking. Staff was friendly but wouldn't do anything for us. We called Expedia who quickly found us another hotel and booked it for us. Other reviews have been glowing but this was just really awful for us. Top building may be better than the annex that sits farther back. There are other cleaner and nicer hotels in Branson for the same price or even lower priced.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: momof5js
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Gazebo Inn. Got a really good deal booking through the Branson Tourism Center which included tickets for 2 to 2 different shows. We enjoyed our stay at Gazebo Inn. It is centrally located on Hwy 76 and is within walking distance to many restaurants, shows, and other activities. Just 2 minutes from the Tanger Mall and a short drive from The Landing. Nice accomodations and extremely nice and helpful staff. Wish the breakfast area was a little larger and fresh fruit was available at breakfast. Overall, we were very satisfed with our accomodations and stay at the Gazebo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: DaveWiWak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. With the special offer of showing $50.00 in gasoilne expense during the trip our bill was reduced by 50.00. It was clean and the service was good. However, the breakfast area is entirely too small, we decided on most days to eat our food outside. because of the way Branson is set up, it can be a chore just to get on the main strip, you will wait until someone is nice enough to let you in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the jacuzzi!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeannieKingfisher_OK
Reviews.Content: The room that we reserved had a jacuzzi tub in it. The tub needs to be replaced as it was cracked all around. Just not in the best shape, but it did work. Beds were comfortable. They also advertised $30.00 free gas for 2 nights stay and $50.00 for 3 nights stay. That was a joke. We stayed for 3 nights and gave them the reciept for gas as the coupon said but they would not honor it, because we went through another company to get our rooms. Why should that matter, they still got their money for our rooms. Very disappointing!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: melaniecj3720
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel! There are a bunch of entertainment venues and restaurants around on the "strip" within walking distance. It almost looks like a miniature Vegas with all the lights. Checking in was easy and everyone was very friendly. My only problems were the internet and shower. The wifi worked well in the room for most of the time but one night it pretty much didn't work at all. And watch out in the shower! It would get randomly really scalding hot and it burned me several times out of nowhere! Also, there is not microwave in the rooms unless you pay extra, but I think the breakfast room stays open with a microwave you can use in there (not sure though). Otherwise, enjoyed my stay completely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: barkerpolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to branson with our teenage son and his friend. We stayed at the Gazebo because it was close to the attractions and there weren't as many of us to worry about on this trip. We loved this place. Very clean rooms and the staff were friendly. I would certainly recommend it to my friends. IT was nothing fancy, but the rooms were clean and nice. It was within walking distance to several area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean, conveniently located, quiet”
Reviews.Author: moshpa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a king room with jacuzzi in Nov 2010. The room itself was smaller than it appeared on the photos, but it was adequate, and very clean. Our room was in the annex building, on the back side of the hotel, so far from the noise of the traffic of the strip. The location was convenient, right on the strip, across from the Tanger Outlet Mall. All of the staff we came in contact with (reception desk, breakfast servers) were very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendliness and service were wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: gam4me
Reviews.Content: When staff realized we had no car, they allowed early check in and made sure our room was close to the lobby. They also stored our luggage after check out due to an afternoon shuttle to the airport.. All staff members at the front desk, housekeeping and breakfast room were very friendly and efficient. Rooms were small, but clean and had all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Hawgwild73
Reviews.Content: $39.99 a night? You can't go wrong! Pool is small and continental breakfast was crowded into a small serving area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cardsfan19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Gazebo Inn May 2 through May 6 on our honeymoon. We had the Honeymoon Suite upstairs in the main buildilng. Check-in was easy and they even had our names on the marquee outside! Front desk called to make sure everything was okay a few minutes after we got to the room. Room was nice, bed was comfortable. Vicki was great in helping us make our room and show reservations and everything went as planned . . . great seats and great shows (Jim Stafford and SIX). The hotel is located right on the strip and everything was easily accessible . . . . maybe too accessible to all the outlet malls!! Overall, I would highly recommend the Honeymoon Suite to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: keepingitsimple
Reviews.Content: The Gazebo Inn is a great place to stay for the price. The staff was more than accomodating and we received a phone call from the front desk minutes after we had arrived in the room to make certain that we were satisfied with the room. While the hotel was older, the rooms were kept very clean. Our unit had an air conditioner / heater that had to have been recently updated because it had digital controls vs. the old knob controls. The unit was very quiet. The shower stalls appeared to be recently replaced and it had a new shower curtain. The towels were soft and fresh smelling. The free breakfast included hot waffles, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, donuts, yogurt, coffee, milk and hot chocolate. The chocolate chip cookies at the front desk were waiting for us when we got back from the day's activities. The hotel is located on the strip in the heart of Branson and was a short walk to some of the shopping, shows and restaurants in the area. I would say that it is a hotel that is nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place; great price”
Reviews.Author: nolenfam
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is inexpensive with a loyalty program. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly. We did not have the complimentary brekafast because Krispy Kreme is just across the street! I strongly recommend this hotel. The only minor complaint is the air condition cycles off completely. However, I was told we could ask for a fan. Great vaule for your money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION,VERY COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Rachel0319
Reviews.Content: First trip to Branson was great and staying at the Gazebo helped make it so. It is centrally located on busy hwy 76 but you can get around fine. Our room was clean & comfortable with a comfy bed and hot water. Location of the rooms(down a hill) might hinder anyone who has a mobility issue. The very small breakfast area DOES have a good breakfast: waffles , donuts, cereal, juice , fruit , yogurt, & hard boiled eggs. The staff was very helpful, we booked our shows through them , which we probably would not do again because it was easy to get tickets. They gave us suggestions and were very friendly. Had a great time & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out For Charges”
Reviews.Author: realityfusion
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to Branson on a vacation and booked through one of the tourism companies in town. After we stayed at the hotel we got charged A TON of money by the Gazebo because they were having disputes with the tourism company. At first I was mad at the tourist company but found out they had contract with Gazebo for rooms, and not only that Gazebo charged me DOUBLE the money that was owed to them by the company we booked with. We contacted the attorney generals office and they said that the fault is with Gazebo not the tourism company. and they are perusing the matter. We still haven't gotten the charges on our card cleared up. Buyer Beware

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: shadowcolorado
Reviews.Content: Found the room to be very quiet (in rear of hotel), good maid service, plenty of towels, coffee pot , small refrig and ironing board included. Had a jet tub which worked fine but was a little cracked here and there. When we had toliet problems it was fixed that day. The counter people were very congenial and the breakfasts were fine. We do suggest a small coffee table be placed in front of the sofa for easier use with cups, etc. Bed was comfortable. Could not open windows is a negative since we happen to like fresh air but a ceilng fan would take care of air movement? All in all our experience was very satisfactory and we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but .....”
Reviews.Author: TravisOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Good location and clean, quite room. Parking is extremely difficult and the air conditioner in the room did not work. Just warm enough in the room to make it hard to sleep. When I mentioned this to the clerk at check-out she became argumenative. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: dondee2009
Reviews.Content: We found the Gazebo Inn to be very enjoyable. It is a smoke free site. I usually struggle with motel rooms but there was no odor at all in the rooms. It was very clean. The employees were friendly and helpful. The room had a few small problems as any room would but they were taken care of quickly. And, they had a good contental breakfast including waffles prepared for you. We will be staying there again in December. Don

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: 4watt
Reviews.Content: We paid $55/night for a 4 night stay. The room was clean and spacious with good parking. Great location, except the entrance is not very noticeable. Beds were soft with extra pillows. A/C worked well and it also had a fridge. The breakfast room was a little small with a lady that insisted she'd make you waffles and cleaned up after you rather hastefully. The continental breakfast was better then the buffet at Peppercorn's across the street. We booked on-line however, when you get there and drive up and down the strip there are numerous hotels/motels costing a lot less with the same amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: dannydanielle_23
Reviews.Content: First of all I don't know what we were expecting for a 2 star hotel but apparently even Gazebo Inn didn't even meet the criteria for a 2 star! We were very disappointed in a number of things during our 5 night stay at the Gazebo Inn. One of which was the little plastic notes left on the bed and by the sink asking us to reuse our towels and linens. The note by the sink asked that we preserve the planet and reuse our towels. Also, there was an envelope on the desk asking us to leave money for our housekeeper . Are you kidding me!? Next was the continental breakfast....we read online that they served scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage as well as cold cereal. Come to find out...there was nothing hot served except a waffle that you had to wait several minutes in line to have the lady make or you had to make it your own. This place had the same things every morning and the juice was horrible! Another thing we were disappointed in was the noisy atmosphere. Every night we couldn't sleep either because there were young kids screaming and yelling at 3 am or because the person next door was yelling and screaming at their partner. We were just very disappointed in what we experienced on our stay there. It was nothing like it looked or had online. The one good thing was that it did offer free wireless internet. I do know one thing we're never staying at the Gazebo Inn again...and we're never going to Branson again either!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JoshandIssa
Reviews.Content: Gazebo Inn is just another motor lodge for around $50 a night in the Branson area. These places are horrible for anyone expecting a real hotel stay, even Quality Inn or Red Roof Inn have these places beat! Our “Jacuzzi Suite” was a standard sized hotel room with a fake whirlpool tub poorly crammed into the tiny bathroom. To do this they moved the sink outside the restroom into an awkward place inside the main room area. The tub was covered in mold, the off white color jets were stained black and green with mold and the walls adjoining the tub were just plain appalling. They were caved in and covered in more mold/bad plaster jobs. The ceiling had the faux plastic panels to cover up the real ceiling (also covered in mold). The actual room was old and busted. The sheets were falling apart, the mattress was old and sagging and the air conditioner barely worked and was rusty. We got a “courtesy call” asking how our room was and when I informed the front desk of how nasty the room was I got a rude “well do you want us to send someone over to look at it”. I of course said no; they obviously know the kind of establishment they run there. I’m sure every room looked the same way. I guess I expected too much after the glowing reviews found here on tripadvisor, but I suppose you get what you pay for, which isn’t much. I went expecting small town charm/hospitality and got a rundown motor lodge that looked at least 40 years old… never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: clb83
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Gazebo Inn multiple times. Nice continental breakfast; clean rooms; accomadating staff; convenient to shows; outlet mall across the street. WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: janeybug
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from my room at the Gazebo Inn. Contrary to earlier reviews, the internet does work! Our room was very clean, even though it was a bit small. The beds are very comfortable, & there were extra pillows in the room. Plenty of towels also for the two of us. Some sort of floor lamp between the beds would have been nice. There is no overhead light & it is somewhat hard to see without opening the drapes at times. More space around the sink would have been nice. The best part about this room is the jacuzzi tub! Even though it is in a small bathroom, the tub is large & the jets are great! The staff has been very nice. I have not tried the breakfast, but my husband has had no complaints. The location has been the most negative part of the stay for us. Although it is on the strip, it is a bit hard to see the hotel due to the traffic because it is literally down in a hole on the side of the hill. We were also in the very back row of the back building. This was our first stay in Branson. We will probably stay off of the strip on our next visit now that we have learned how to get around the area & how to avoid long waits in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ceci_at
Reviews.Content: Very clean and friendly staff; location was excellent and the breakfast was very good! If ever in that area again, I would stay there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Patskinner
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. We were asked several times through the day if everything was okay. Even at a higher rate we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: pmathis
Reviews.Content: After many hours of trying to find a place in Branson to stay we found the Gazebo Inn online. It seemed ok and my wife loved the quaintness of it. After arriving at 4:00 our room was still not ready - we should have just left. We waited for another 45 minutes before given keys to the room. Once we drove down to the second building where our room was our keys would not work so we drove back up and were issued new ones. Still no luck so they moved us to another room in the first building. We threw our stuff in there becuase we had to eat and then go to a show. We got back to the hotel around 10:30 and then at 11pm the golf cart parked right outside our door gets started and an employee takes it to the back building. The next day when we got back housekeeping never came to our room but it was so late ( midnight) that we just let it go, besides the office was closed anyway. Then the next morning at 9 am housekeeping walks into our room without knocking and says that he didn't have our room as being rented. I had to tell them who I was and that I moved rooms when I first checked in - so they had no idea that I was in that room for two days! After being woke up I decided to stop by the breakfast room and get some fruit or something but it is too small and I couldn't even get in. I talked to the manager in the morning and he just defended everything that happened stating that errors happen - which I understand too but it was just too many errors. He did offer me a gift certificate that I could come back on - I passed explaining that I never have intentions of coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Headaches galore”
Reviews.Author: kjwKc
Reviews.Content: We booked this motel for a stay over the 4th of July weekend. On the second day, we stopped by our room for a minute to walk our dog and take back off to make our plans on time, and arrived to find the door lock wouldn't work. We were locked outside with our 22 month old son and had our dog locked inside due to stuck hardware in the mechanism. They were unable to unlock it and had to break the lock out after drilling it with a hole saw to get in (did I mention my dog is terrified of power tools and extreme noise like this?). This took over 1 1/2 hours, completely ruining our evening plans and on time arrival at them. We were then moved into a different room. I moved all of our stuff over to it (staff offered to help, but didn't want our personal items handled). Then on the evening of the 4th at about 11:30 p.m., after spending 1 1/2 hours in traffic trying to get back to our room after watching fireworks, we returned to find the lock on the new room wouldn't read either of our key cards. I had to go to the office (which was closed) and call an emergency number on there while my wife, very tired son, and dog waited. Then we had to wait over 20 minutes for the manager to open the door with his key card. The manager tried to say the next day that the lock batteries were low was why it didn't work (yet his card did???), however I had the desk clerk check the cards, and he said they had no information on them, leading me to believe when the manager did activate them for the new room, he didn't activate them long enough for them to work the remainder of our stay. It was obvious maintenance upkeep isn't a big concern at this place due to rotted railings near the office, old looking rooms, and even no grout in the tile back trim in the bathrooms. Not to mention locks that don't work consistently. We did get a comp for one night for our troubles, but for a ruined vacation, it wasn't even remotely worth it. The staff were all friendly and helpful, it was just a bad overall experience and they need to spend some money to update the finishes and make sure the locks actually work consistently.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBISHOFF
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well maintained, the staff was very friendly and helpful, furnishings were very nice, great location and the continental breakfast was very good (consisted of hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, yogurt, mixed fruit, juice, coffee, donuts/rolls and cereal). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gazebo Inn”
Reviews.Author: mimiandpoppy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with family and took elderly mother.It has been recently redecorated, new carpeting, new mattresses, as well as bedding. Everything was extra clean and NO MOLD. There are only three stairs if staying in first level, otherwise one can drive right up to room on road leading down to 2nd and 3rd levels. Very quaint, even though on main highway, sets back and still very quiet. We loved it and front desk personel, VERY courteous. Since we're animal lovers, we even enjoyed watching the beautiful red Cardinals in the morning and even feeding a big fluffy rabbit over the side of our balcony! Miss Helen in continental breakfast room, a little too helpful, but means well. Our overall stay was GREAT! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reserved room not honored”
Reviews.Author: gwb_dance
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for two nights at the Gazebo for my son and daughter-in-law. Upon arrival the first evening, the manager informed my son that they did not have a room for him. He said that since he had arrived a little later in the evening, he had given the room to someone else. This was very strange since it was prepaid for the two nights. The manager took it upon himself to fax my credit card information, without my permission, to an unafiliated, lower quality hotel, to reserve the two a room for the two nights. This was very disappointing for my son and daughter-in-law since it was their first vacation in 14 years, and I was irate over the whole situation. I called the Gazebo for two days to speak with the owner or manager and finally on the third day, we did speak. He apologized for the incident, knowing full well that they totally did the wrong thing, especially faxing my credit card information to someone else. The manager did somewhat make this right, not for my son though, by sending me a certificate for two complimentary nights at the Gazebo. I don't know that I would recommend this hotel to anyone if they can't even hold a room for you when it is prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed This Time...”
Reviews.Author: tricia_page
Reviews.Content: We take a trip to Branson every year and have stayed at the Gazebo Inn for the past 8 years. We have been pleased with our stay until this year. We were VERY disappointed. I don't know if they have new management, new owners or what - but it wasn't the same. 1st off - every time we tried to leave our room we would have to fiddle with the door handle for about 5 to 10 minutes before we could even get OUT! The card key worked fine from the outside but when we were on the inside - it was a disaster. The deadbolt would never close either. We told the desk clerk about the door and she said she would have someone take a look at it. That was the first night - and no one ever took a look at it for the 4 nights that we were there. So - everytime we left our room we had to spend a lot of time trying to get out. What if there had been a fire and we couldn't get out? We told the desk clerk this and she just looked at us like she thought we were crazy. 2nd - the continential breakfast. We didn't feel it was as good as usual but it wasn't bad. However, the lady that prepared it (named Helen - I think) was a nuisance! She was in the way - everywhere you turned. You couldn't get your food because she wouldn't get out of the way. One day we walked in and she shouted at us, "STOP RIGHT THERE!" and proceeded to tell us what there was to eat. Yes - I have eyes - I can see it. Besides, that - I had been here many times before and know how to get around. Another thing that irritated us was that she had a tip jar. I understand that people do this - but this was to be a free breakfast. You pay enough for the room without having to pay for the (free) breakfast as well. Besides, that - why pay someone that was more of a nuisance than they were good? I think it is time for a change next year. The Branson's Best motel seems like they have good reviews and look similar in price - we might try that next year....

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely”
Reviews.Author: limey43
Reviews.Content: The time I spent in Branson MO. was great, the shows were fantastic the people were so friendly and food very good, but what touched my heart the most was the Gazebo Inn. I just can't stop raving about it, I am so looking forward to coming back. The rooms very clean no probems at all, the property was just beautiful. Everyone made us very welcomed, but Helen made us feel like were her family. If I could I would give the Gazebo Inn 5 stars. Thank You..............................Veronica Farrell

Reviews.Title: “Great Gazebo Inn”
Reviews.Author: sroch3032
Reviews.Content: This quaint inn was absolutely perfect! The room was spotless as was the entire surrounding property. The staff was awesome...very friendly and most helpful. We expecially loved breakfast with Helen...she was the best. Made us feel like we were sitting in her own kitchen! Would definitely stay there again and have been recommending others to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: carfamily
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Branson having stayed 5 nights at the Gazebo Inn. This Inn is very cute, especially for girls since it looks like a dollhouse. As to the rooms, they're your average room for the price. We had a room at the back and loved it. It faced some little woods and was very private. The only problem with the rooms was the door was very hard to open (they still have keys-not keycards). Also the air conditioning is hard to get regulated. But if you put it on 60-62 degrees it works well. As to the staff, I must say they are excellent. The maid service is especially nice. The breakfast was staffed with a very nice lady who helped us with our breakfast...which was a wide selection from cereals to oatmeal, toast, juices, milk, coffee and lots of other choices. We had a pleasant experience at the Gazebo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay....”
Reviews.Author: carplustwo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very close to alot of different attractions. The inn keepers were very helpful. Room was very quite and larger then a standard hotel room. The bathroom door would not lock but it was not a problem for us. We would leave for a few hours and come back to a clean room. The room was clean and we always had fresh towels. We did not eat the breakfast that was served everyday. However, it had to be better then Peppercorns Restaurant a cross the road. Don't eat there.. not good. Go next door to Denny's or try the free breakfast. Overall we had a great time. The best show we seen was the Justin Flom's magic palor and imaginary threater.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Prfctangelgonebd
Reviews.Content: Loved it!! Stayed in the honeymoon suite for 1 yr anniversary. The only complaint is the room's wallpaper, comforter, and couch in the room had alot of flowers. Flower overkill!!!! The staff was very friendly. The breakfast great. Bed was very comfy. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “loved it here”
Reviews.Author: granma9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 35th ann. in the honneymoon suite- the room was clean bright and comfortable-the housekeeping was great always had fresh towel-plenty of coffee-shampoo ect. the rooms were clean and ready when we got back from our trips to the shows ect. everyone was friendly and helpful-love the looks very charming-would gladly stay again-would help if they had a snack machine for those late nite muchies

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: jess855
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gazebo Inn October 20-26 and had a wonderful stay. When I booked my room they offered to also reserve shows for me. I had great seats to all six shows they booked, and they also helped arrange a shuttle service for me since anyone who has ever been to Branson knows the traffic! The room was very clean with a little fridge that I did not even request. The breakfast in the morning is very good but you just have to make sure you don't get there at 8 am since it gets very busy. The staff was very nice, welcoming, and very informative. I had a great time and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kisskid
Reviews.Content: Great Location and priced right! We asked for ground level and got it, asked for a fridge and got it. Our room was clean and comfortable. Not 5 stars, but we didn't pay 5 star prices. We would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Renee31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gazebo Inn for three nights and it was a very nice and clean place. My friend had got on here and read some reviews about it that made it sound bad. So we wanted to write and say that it isn't a bad place to stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “worst place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: lwwhite
Reviews.Content: Reserved the honeymoon suite and thought it would be a special occasion so was willing for fork over the extra $$. We got a room with a jauzzi but the toilet was stopped up. Called the desk and they said they had no plumber??? So a maid came about an hour later with a little plunger and worked on it. Finally she said she couldn't fix it so we went back to the desk and was moved to another room in the back facing a brick wall. We had to carry our stuff from one building to the other. One night was enough, so we checked out the next morning. He still charged me for the full rate for the honeymoon suite although we didn't stay there. Rude and insulting. When I got home I found that he had billed for two rooms for the entire time although we only stayed one night. When I called I recognized the voice, and he recognized me. His last words before hanging up on me were '---'. I called the Chamber of Commerce. I got the extra charges removed from my card. As a federal employee I traveled frequently over a period of 17 years. I never had as bad an experience as this place. Save yourself some headaches. Go elsewhere!

HotelInfo.Name: Gazebo Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2424 W. Hwy. 76, Branson, MO 65616
